p: No activity of β-elemene, as well as N. damascena essential oil, was observed against Staphylococcus aureus, Staphylococcus epidermidis, Escherichia coli, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Candida albicans, Candida parapsilosis, and Mycobacterium smegmatis (MIC > 1000 μg/mL); however, the medium activity was noticed for both samples against M. tuberculosis (MIC value of 128 μg/mL and 256 μg/mL for β-elemene and EO, respectively). The obtained results clearly indicate that N. damascena EO and β-elemene itself exert moderate action against M. tuberculosis H37Ra strain ( Table 4).
